ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: The course offered a great look at energy by technology type.

The only comment I could suggest to improve the content and the pacing of thecourse would be to pick up the pace ever so slightly. Bill does a wonderful job of explaining concepts and the material is carefully selected and excerpted for discussion in class. Still, due to student questions and the seminar setting for the class, delays invariably slow down the pace and some material is cannabalized due to lost time. Just slightly fewer slides--or time allotted specifically for discussion during class-time--might alleviate this time-crunch when the schedule starts to get slightly behind.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Question 4: More knowledge could be created from the course if certain topics were given more class time. Devoting one class to the coal industry, for example is an incredibly light treatment of a very complex and deep subject matter. Also, the industrial ecology concepts relevant to these industries were at times lightly applied. Though this was an advanced industrial ecology seminar, I do not feel a great famalairity with how industry ecology provides additional understanding to the parts of the energy industry we studiedThe professor was very accessible and took great effort to provide knowledge to the students.
The field trips and guest speakers.
Professor Ellis has an incredible depth of knowledge. The class speakers he brought in were great. The student lead discussions facilitated participation well.
Roundtable DiscussionsFlexibility in choosing a term projectField trip to ISO New England was excellentThe topics of the reading responses were also very relevant
The lectures and interaction with the wide range of guest speakers was very interesting and beneficial.
The ISO field tripwas great and the first-hand knowledge of Bill and the guest lecturer.

Professor Ellis is a delight and an exemplary instructor.The syllabus was carefully put together and the thought that went into making it was noticeable.The readings were varied, interesting, and worth the time.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: The course could focus more on industrial ecology and emphasize certain topics be covered. At times, guest speakers or student led discussions were too broad and didn't help create any specific understanding on the importance of integral features of the industries being studied.Feedback on our work would have been helpful. Students received no grades on reading responses, student led roundtables, or our presentations.
Wish there could be more research based discussions.
Lecture pacing- we would run out of time for discussions and round tables.

The student led discussion mostly only took time away from the more content filled lectures and in-lecture discussions. The incentives to participate in the discussion led to some students contributing for the sake of contributing.

Again, maybe a little more structured discussion to prevent the interruptions (all positive) that come during the lecture or presentation.Additionally, although it's hard to keep guest speakers on time and on subject, perhaps a little more careful massaging of the guest speaker's time will prevent overruns and will preserve class-time that guests won't eat into. In my opinion, Professor Ellis' lectures are just as valuable as anything a guest speaker has to say!

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: The field trips were great compliment to the class.
As mentioned in 15, the time for the student-led discussions could have been used better. The expectations could be also set more clearly
N/A

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: It's a great subject-specific course on energy.
A much needed energy course.
I have an energy background and this course expanded my knowledge.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: To develop a deeper understanding of different sectors of the energy industry, especially as viewed through the paradigm of industrial ecology.
It's one of the classes recommended for the energy and environment track.
To get an overview of the different energy sectors

Professor Ellis is an excellent instructor with a lot of experience in energy. This program covered a variety of different technologies and current relevant issues within the energy industry. The experience and quality of the discussions amongst the students was also excellent.
A great exposure to the most important technical and economic issues in the energy sector.

because of Professor Ellis' reputation as a leader and instructor. I didn't necessarily need some of the information taught, but rather wanted to hear some familiar information from a revered source (Ellis).

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: I developed significant knowledge through this course, though it was not very related to industrial ecology
Yes, it provided what exactly I was hoping to learn.
Yes, I'm happy with the breadth and depth of information covered.
Yes
Yes, the course proved to be excellent (as expected)
yes
Yes.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Thinking and strategizing with committed, engaged students!
I enjoyed the group work process overall.
Uncoordinated and no clear expectationsGood opportunity to get to know other students and their background

The advantages were division of labor in order to write a fairly comprehensive report on a subject unfamiliar to my teammate and I. I wouldn't have been able to write such a large report without a teammate's help.The disadvantages were the typical challenges of working with a teammate: differing expectations for the quality of the deliverable, communication challenges, and unexpected events holding up progress and causing delays. Nothing new--just the challenge of working with another person on a co-authored report.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Think of this more as a survey course of relevant sectors of the energy industry. Don't come in expecting to have a new understanding of industrial ecology concepts.If you enjoy thinking, reading, and talking about energy concepts, you will get a good deal from this class, as it provides ample opportunity to do so.
It's a great class and I would strongly recommend it to students who are interested in the energy and environment track.
Take complete advantage of the other students experience and Prof. Ellis knowledge to benefit from the class.
If you're considering working in energy, this class is as essential as any other at F&ES.
